item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:20, topic:274989”]r u srsly
did anyone notice he said countdown? So why are you all using incrementing loops? And why are you even using while loops instead of for loops?

for(int i = 20; i >= 0; i--) { sendMessage("In :" + i); if(i == 0) sendMessage("BOOM LOL NOOB"); } [/quote] I <3u

Read full topic

item.title: Loops
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

r u srsly
did anyone notice he said countdown? So why are you all using incrementing loops? And why are you even using while loops instead of for loops?

for(int i = 20; i >= 0; i--) {
    sendMessage("In :" + i);
    if(i == 0)
        sendMessage("BOOM LOL NOOB");
}

item.title: Loops
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:15, topic:274989”][quote author=`Joshua link=topic=363288.msg2759496#msg2759496 date=1240439204]

int i = 1;
while (i < 21) {
sendMessage("in "+i);
i++;
}
if (i == 20) { sendMessage("BOOM LOL NOOB"); }

Try this, should work.
[/quote]

I hate your conventions.[/quote]
Shut the fuck up. Seriously, He isn’t making a tutorial, So it doesn’t need to be perfect. Tbh I don’t fucking mind, I’ll fix them myself when I put them in.

Read full topic

i++;
}
if (i == 20) { sendMessage("BOOM LOL NOOB"); }

Try this, should work.
[/quote]

I hate your conventions.[/quote]

I didn’t bother with conventions because i quickly wrote that on moparscape and in my room its dark, so sthu flaming. God you’re such a faggot. Seriously: You do one thing not perfect here and its all gtfo…Wow lol

item.title: Loops
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“P I M P 3 D Tut, post:14, topic:274989”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=363288.msg2759510#msg2759510 date=1240439557]
It’s pretty sad, in my opinion, nobody can figure out how to do this.

for(byte i = 0; i < 21; i++) { if(i == 20) sendMessage("BOOM"); }

Just use a byte for the luls, since the for doesn’t loop over 127 times. Byte = 8 bits, int = 32

For there to be a pause in loop iterations, you’d have to call some sort of thread sleep function.
[/quote] Never thought of using a byte, yet it doesn’t do the countdown, It just prints “BOOM”.[/quote]It DOES do the countdown, there just isn’t a delay.

You’d have to add something to the end of the loop, such as Thread.currentThread().sleep(500); for it to be delayed.

Read full topic

item.title: Loops
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

It’s pretty sad, in my opinion, nobody can figure out how to do this.

for(byte i = 0; i < 21; i++) { if(i == 20) sendMessage("BOOM"); }

Just use a byte for the luls, since the for doesn’t loop over 127 times. Byte = 8 bits, int = 32

For there to be a pause in loop iterations, you’d have to call some sort of thread sleep function.

Read full topic

item.title: Loops
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

for(int i=1; i<21; i++){ sendMessage("In: " + i);
Alright, I’m not going to tell you what I’m really using this for, But.
Lets say, I want a countdown from twenty, and when it’s at 20 Let’s say I want it to say

 sendMessage("BOOMLOLOLOL");

I tried doing,

for(int i=1; i<21; i++){ sendMessage("In: " + i); sendMessage("BOOMLOLOLOL") But, That doesn’t work, After every number it print’s it’ll go boomok,ololololol kay?

I don’t want to do

sendMessage("1"); sendMessage("2"); sendMessage("3"); sendMessage("4"); Because there’s no timer between them, When I’m using the loop, It takes time to print.
If anyone gets me, Do you have a solution for me?

Kthnx.

Read full topic
